4adc0b312f83.title: I think the coolest life feature is the option to be just ‘any-body.’

paragraphs.text: I think the coolest life feature is the option to be just ‘any-body.’ Labels suck. And the lack of realness and society pressure bugs me too. But we are still us down there, we are just changing roles. Today I’m a poet and a writer, a daughter and a grandaughter. Maybe one day I’ll be a wife a mother or a firefighter. Or just ‘any-body.’
paragraphs.name: c418

db3bfd4b775c.title: Hi Nita, thanks for your response.

content.subtitle: There are millions of things you can ‘do’ out there, for a living or for a hobby, but ultimately these things can’t make us truly happy in…

virtuals.subtitle: There are millions of things you can ‘do’ out there, for a living or for a hobby, but ultimately these things can’t make us truly happy in…

paragraphs.text: Hi Nita, thanks for your response.
paragraphs.name: e696

paragraphs.text: There are millions of things you can ‘do’ out there, for a living or for a hobby, but ultimately these things can’t make us truly happy in themselves. It is the energy or attitude we bring to whatever we do that provides our purpose. This is for me where mindfulness comes into it. If we are…
paragraphs.name: 684b

paragraphs.text: What makes that “better?” What makes you think anyone, regardless of how celebrated, isn’t asking these questions?
paragraphs.name: d946

ed7cd983e976.title: Why Does Everybody Want to Be Somebody?

content.subtitle: From the minute we are born we are encouraged to try and be ‘some-body’.

virtuals.subtitle: From the minute we are born we are encouraged to try and be ‘some-body’.

paragraphs.text: Why Does Everybody Want to Be Somebody?
From the minute we are born we are encouraged to try and be ‘some-body’.
paragraphs.name: b12c

e6802e41dd8c.title: This piece really resonated with me and I’m sure with many other no-bodies out there!

paragraphs.text: This piece really resonated with me and I’m sure with many other no-bodies out there! I’ve been struggling with finding a sense of purpose in 2016 and your thoughts make me think that my purpose is not out there, not to be a some-body, but in here, in this no-body and it’s influence on those close to me. Have you found yours yet?
paragraphs.name: e301

feb832e5132e.title: I think the term ‘nobody’ can be seen as a negative, ie not worth anything but I see it as just the…

paragraphs.text: I think the term ‘nobody’ can be seen as a negative, ie not worth anything but I see it as just the opposite. I see it as just ‘getting out of our own way’, allowing and accepting the thinking mind and the ego and moving beyond them, therefore allowing our true essence to come through. So maybe instead of ‘no-body’ or ‘no-thing’ it should be a ‘no-THINK’.
paragraphs.name: 85f2

paragraphs.text: And no-body is perfect ;)

content.subtitle: I’m not trying to be somebody and I’m not nobody (I hope) … I’m rather content at being me.

virtuals.subtitle: I’m not trying to be somebody and I’m not nobody (I hope) … I’m rather content at being me.

paragraphs.text: Hi,
I’m not trying to be somebody and I’m not nobody (I hope) … I’m rather content at being me.
That’s not something easily achieved, but worth trying.
paragraphs.name: 40fd

paragraphs.text: You are absolutely right Tom. That’s a poor choice of words on my behalf, as ‘better’ does suggest a hierarchy of behaviour which isn’t what I really meant, nor to deny that ‘celebrated’ people are also questioning their existence. I wanted the sentence to back up what I had previously said regarding the deaths of these ‘celebrated’ people and it…
paragraphs.name: 54ed

c154cf3d4c81.title: Thank you this article is a refreshing change of pace on Medium.

paragraphs.text: Thank you this article is a refreshing change of pace on Medium. Instead of whining, complaining and shaming others, it directs us to start making a change in the only place it matters and can be effective…with ourselves. I have started meditating myself, and like everything else, it takes patience and practice to achieve the benefits.
paragraphs.name: 27af

6d21dc43b976.title: If you live a life of that a no-body, eventually you find peace, peace of mind and of heart.

paragraphs.text: If you live a life of that a no-body, eventually you find peace, peace of mind and of heart. This will lead you to finding real people around. Love this article Rik.
paragraphs.name: c8c2

158baa0bc3e5.title: Thank you for this — we can never fully know the hearts and intentions of all the ‘some-bodies’ out…

paragraphs.text: Thank you for this — we can never fully know the hearts and intentions of all the ‘some-bodies’ out there, but what truer depiction of our equal humanity than the experience of death. And what better reminder to seek humility and inner peace; at the end of life that’s all any of us have. As a hospice nurse I sit with all sorts of people, rich or poor…
paragraphs.name: 5e2f

858024ca9581.title: I was born somebody — and I’ll never back down.

paragraphs.text: I was born somebody — and I’ll never back down.

4b086e345454.title: I loved your article Rik but don’t you think it’s important to be that somebody at some point of…

paragraphs.text: I loved your article Rik but don’t you think it’s important to be that somebody at some point of time in our lives. We all define success in a different way still it is important to have that one quality that drives one insane, call it ego or passion or greed. Although, I personally think that there is always a trade-off involved between that somebody and nobody and both are equally important.
paragraphs.name: 3f05

content.subtitle: Absolutely, I’m all for passion and totally get what you say when you say ‘that one quality that drives one insane’. We all can have that…

virtuals.subtitle: Absolutely, I’m all for passion and totally get what you say when you say ‘that one quality that drives one insane’. We all can have that…

paragraphs.text: Thank you for your response.
paragraphs.name: 0bb8

paragraphs.text: Absolutely, I’m all for passion and totally get what you say when you say ‘that one quality that drives one insane’. We all can have that one thing that resonates with us especially, no matter what it is. In many ways this is what is known as the Tao. Our purpose, our plan, our path. This could…
paragraphs.name: a670

d88e46557c95.title: I love this article, to me, it’s a soft reminder that it is not our position in the world that…

paragraphs.text: I love this article, to me, it’s a soft reminder that it is not our position in the world that determines our impact or worth, and that our self-awareness and acceptance of being ‘ordinary’ is both liberating and constructive. I have often admired those who are content with their circumstances and who quietly bring about positive change through…
paragraphs.name: b3a1

75f71db26fb2a5c1fe6d2ed02426710e.title: I loved your article Rik but don’t you think it’s important to be that somebody at some point of…

d668ffc571be080221eee0a78cfef72a.title: This piece really resonated with me and I’m sure with many other no-bodies out there!

f67501f96f6cab61a5d2486b0cd6ea3c.title: Why Does Everybody Want to Be Somebody?

paragraphs.text: Isn’t it better to spend our lives understanding what lies behind the body? Who are we really? What are we really? What are we doing here? What is our true purpose? Are we happy? Why are we unhappy?
paragraphs.name: 4a54
